citations.narrative:
The facility is not maintaining some fox enclosures to protect the animal from injury. In multiple fox enclosures there are
pieces of chewed wood and metal fencing with sharp edges. Rough and sharp edges pose an injury risk to animals. The
licensee must ensure that indoor and outdoor housing facilities are structurally sound and maintained in good repair to
protect the animals from injury and to contain the animals.
To be corrected by February 19, 2025.
This inspection and exit interview were conducted with facility representatives.
n

narrative:
3.125(a) 
   
Facilities, general. 
The facility is not maintaining some fox enclosures to protect the animal from injury. In multiple fox enclosures there are 
pieces of chewed wood and metal fencing with sharp edges. Rough and sharp edges pose an injury risk to animals. The 
licensee must ensure that indoor and outdoor housing facilities are structurally sound and maintained in good repair to 
protect the animals from injury and to contain the animals. 
 
To be corrected by February 19, 2025. 
 
This inspection and exit interview were conducted with facility representatives. 
 
 n

species.common: RED FOX (INCLUDES SILVER FOX & CROSS FOX)
